2019-08-19 07:19:37.528769 | centos-7 | Evaluation Error: Error while evaluating a Function Call, Could not find class ::rabbitmq::params for centos-7-rax-ord-0010255916 (file: /home/zuul/workspace/spec/fixtures/modules/tripleo/manifests/certmonger/rabbitmq.pp, line: 51, column: 3) on node centos-7-rax-ord-0010255916

Let's remove any reference to rabbitmq::params and also the following
two notifies:
  File[$service_certificate] ~> Service<| title == $::rabbitmq::service_name |>
  File[$service_key] ~> Service<| title == $::rabbitmq::service_name |>

They do nothing in a containerized deployment anyway.

Tested as follows:
- Full downstream OSP15 HA deploy

Change-Id: Ib7c373c10ff7bcd8ec33cb912a8a0a4a32a196e2
Closes-Bug: #1840641
"}]
commit_message:
Make puppet-tripleo compatible with latest puppet-rabbitmq

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677082/ merged today and moved puppet-rabbitmq to 9.1.0
which is breaking our spec tests:

https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/e767db93fe214514bebc065a64288548/log/job-output.txt

So we error out with things like:
2019-08-19 07:19:37.527187 | centos-7 | 1) tripleo::certmonger::rabbitmq on redhat-7-x86_64 behaves like tripleo::certmonger::rabbitmq should include the base for using certmonger
2019-08-19 07:19:37.527435 | centos-7 | Failure/Error: include ::rabbitmq::params
2019-08-19 07:19:37.527713 | centos-7 | Puppet::PreformattedError:
2019-08-19 07:19:37.528769 | centos-7 | Evaluation Error: Error while evaluating a Function Call, Could not find class ::rabbitmq::params for centos-7-rax-ord-0010255916 (file: /home/zuul/workspace/spec/fixtures/modules/tripleo/manifests/certmonger/rabbitmq.pp, line: 51, column: 3) on node centos-7-rax-ord-0010255916

Let's remove any reference to rabbitmq::params and also the following
two notifies:
  File[$service_certificate] ~> Service<| title == $::rabbitmq::service_name |>
  File[$service_key] ~> Service<| title == $::rabbitmq::service_name |>

They do nothing in a containerized deployment anyway.

Tested as follows:
- Full downstream OSP15 HA deploy

Change-Id: Ib7c373c10ff7bcd8ec33cb912a8a0a4a32a196e2
Closes-Bug: #1840641

commit_message:
Move dnsmasq restarts to privsep.

I don't really love this one, but I don't see a better way to
untangle this.

Change-Id: Icce18320a7c8fba3cf06bd032fbbe1846804e897

commit_message:
Move iptables rule fetching and setting to privsep.

Rules are fetched, edited, and set. Keep the edit logic in nova/network,
but move the bits requiring elevated permissions to privsep.

Change-Id: I1f8382c450b95d261f68ec8bae2a2077f9361fe0

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-15 17:12:10.000000000', 'message': "Fix use of mock.patch with new_callable=PropertyMock

mock.patch's new_callable attribute is supposed to be set to a
callable object which when called will generate the new object for the
patched object to return:

  https://docs.python.org/dev/library/unittest.mock.html#unittest.mock.patch

So when it is desired to return a PropertyMock object, new_callable
should be set to the class, not an instance of the class.

Alternatively if it is desired to set the return value within the
decorator, then the new attribute should be used instead of
new_callable.

So change existing tests to adhere to this principle.  Previously they
passed more or less by accident, due to instances of PropertyMock
themselves being callable even though they are supposed to be used as
properties rather than methods.

Change-Id: I707169384c5732b9ad9f3941a9334f96478d4aab
"}]
commit_message:
Fix use of mock.patch with new_callable=PropertyMock

mock.patch's new_callable attribute is supposed to be set to a
callable object which when called will generate the new object for the
patched object to return:

  https://docs.python.org/dev/library/unittest.mock.html#unittest.mock.patch

So when it is desired to return a PropertyMock object, new_callable
should be set to the class, not an instance of the class.

Alternatively if it is desired to set the return value within the
decorator, then the new attribute should be used instead of
new_callable.

So change existing tests to adhere to this principle.  Previously they
passed more or less by accident, due to instances of PropertyMock
themselves being callable even though they are supposed to be used as
properties rather than methods.

Change-Id: I707169384c5732b9ad9f3941a9334f96478d4aab

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-16 20:12:58.000000000', 'message': 'devstack: Fix libvirtd/libvirt-bin detection

Attempting to devstack on bionic failed with:

Failed to restart libvirt-bin.service: Unit libvirt-bin.service not found.

devstack/lib/ironic was trying to figure out whether our libvirtd
service is called libvirtd or libvirt-bin based on:
- Are we on ubuntu?
- Does /etc/init.d/libvirtd not exist?

 if is_ubuntu && [ ! -f /etc/init.d/libvirtd ]; then
     libvirt_service_name="libvirt-bin"

But on this bionic, for whatever reason, my libvirtd is at
/usr/sbin/libvirtd.

However, `type libvirtd` succeeds in either case.

So this commit broadens the second part of that check accordingly.

Note, FWIW, that devstack's lib/nova_plugins/functions-libvirt checks
this way:

 # Only Xenial is left with libvirt-bin.  Everywhere else is libvirtd
 if is_ubuntu && [ ${DISTRO} == "xenial" ]; then
     LIBVIRT_DAEMON=libvirt-bin
 else
     LIBVIRT_DAEMON=libvirtd
 fi

Change-Id: I94a86a96d5732db60c12399fcaf666f960461e3e
'}]
commit_message:
devstack: Fix libvirtd/libvirt-bin detection

Attempting to devstack on bionic failed with:

Failed to restart libvirt-bin.service: Unit libvirt-bin.service not found.

devstack/lib/ironic was trying to figure out whether our libvirtd
service is called libvirtd or libvirt-bin based on:
- Are we on ubuntu?
- Does /etc/init.d/libvirtd not exist?

 if is_ubuntu && [ ! -f /etc/init.d/libvirtd ]; then
     libvirt_service_name="libvirt-bin"

But on this bionic, for whatever reason, my libvirtd is at
/usr/sbin/libvirtd.

However, `type libvirtd` succeeds in either case.

So this commit broadens the second part of that check accordingly.

Note, FWIW, that devstack's lib/nova_plugins/functions-libvirt checks
this way:

 # Only Xenial is left with libvirt-bin.  Everywhere else is libvirtd
 if is_ubuntu && [ ${DISTRO} == "xenial" ]; then
     LIBVIRT_DAEMON=libvirt-bin
 else
     LIBVIRT_DAEMON=libvirtd
 fi

Change-Id: I94a86a96d5732db60c12399fcaf666f960461e3e

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-12 20:57:39.000000000', 'message': 'Remove rabbit dependency for keystone

The keystone chart currently only utilizes rabbitmq for logging
notifications, which can also be done via the log driver. This change
sets the default notification driver to log instead of messagingv2 and
allows keystone to not rely on rabbitmq when deploying.

If one wishes to use rabbitmq for notifications, this change also
contains a new script that contains the necessary overrides.

Change-Id: I3a59a24d2f8479ce2875d0ddf33eb5e5c57dca7c

'}, {'created': '2019-07-01 21:40:51.000000000', 'message': 'Set keystone audit driver to stdout

This change sets the audit notification driver to log, which will
cause keystone to output any CADF/Basic audit notifications to
stdout.

Also removed the dependency on keystone-api for rabbitmq, as keystone
does not need an instance of rabbitmq outside of emitting notifications,
even then it will simply not emit a notification if rabbit is set
as the driver and not present.

This also adds another conditional to the rabbit-init job for keystone
to check for both the manifest to be set to true, and for the
oslo_messaging_notification driver to be set to "messagingv2" before
setting up rabbit-init.

Change-Id: I3a59a24d2f8479ce2875d0ddf33eb5e5c57dca7c
'}, {'created': '2019-07-01 22:12:36.000000000', 'message': 'Set keystone audit driver to stdout

commit_message:
Set keystone audit driver to stdout

This change sets the audit notification driver to log, which will
cause keystone to output any CADF/Basic audit notifications to
stdout.

Also removed the dependency on keystone-api for rabbitmq, as keystone
does not need an instance of rabbitmq outside of emitting notifications,
even then it will simply not emit a notification if rabbit is set
as the driver and not present.

Change-Id: I3a59a24d2f8479ce2875d0ddf33eb5e5c57dca7c

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-08 22:54:35.000000000', 'message': 'WIP - runner: do not run exec if container not running

When running "podman exec", paunch was only trying to get the container
name from a "podman ps -a" and then run the exec.
It can be problematic if the container isn't running for some reasons.

We should first make sure the container is actually started and then
run the exec.

This patch does:

1) Introduce container_running() which use podman ps stdout to figure if
   whether or not the container is actually running.

TODO: write unit tests e.g. test_container_not_running

2) In the running, if the action is "exec", we expect the container to
   be running so we call container_running and if the result is
   negative, we raise.

3) To investigate, but I don't think the 'validations_passed' variable
   introduced in Ibc458d3badb807a0deef5a799db6682d7128dbc1 really makes
   sense. It doesn't validate anything and moreover we were skipping
   containers which failed that "validation" (!!!).
   In this patch, I commented the variables, suggesting we should change
   them and also converted the "continue" into a "raise", and increased
   the log level from debug to error if validation didn't pass.
   We should rework that piece.

Closes-Bug: #1839559
rhbz#1739224
Co-Authored-By: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: David Peacock <dpeacock@redhat.com>

commit_message:
runner: do not run exec if container not running

When running "podman exec", paunch was only trying to get the container
name from a "podman ps -a" and then run the exec.
It can be problematic if the container isn't running for some reasons.

We should first make sure the container is actually started and then
run the exec.

This patch does:

1) Introduce container_running() which use podman ps stdout to figure if
   whether or not the container is actually running.

2) In the running, if the action is "exec", we expect the container to
   be running so we call container_running and if the result is
   negative, we raise.

Closes-Bug: #1839559
rhbz#1739224
Co-Authored-By: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: David Peacock <dpeacock@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I4bd7d7e238f4d6405c92ac864618a7c34830fd01

commit_message:
runner: do not run exec if container not running

Use "podman" inspect to check if whether or not the container is
running before doing "podman exec"; and raise if not running.

It re-uses what was done for "podman run", where we run the "podman
inspect" by moving a block our of the conditions to always give the
container state for each container in the loop, and send a warning if
the state can't be found.

Closes-Bug: #1839559
rhbz#1739224

Change-Id: I68f806981f3f52890be5d4d73ef5f67868be4ab5

commit_message:
runner: do not run exec if container not running

Use "podman" inspect to check if whether or not the container is
running before doing "podman exec"; and raise if not running.

It re-uses what was done for "podman run", where we run the "podman
inspect" by moving a block our of the conditions to always give the
container state for each container in the loop, and send a warning if
the state can't be found.

Closes-Bug: #1839559
rhbz#1739224

Change-Id: I68f806981f3f52890be5d4d73ef5f67868be4ab5
(cherry picked from commit b2f055f234966729aec274d26932ba8df7091d9b)

commit_message:
New neutron-lib release

It was discussed on today's Neutron team meeting [1] that as soon
as patch [2] will be merged we would like to release new version of
neutron-lib.
As [2] is merged now, we can release new version.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/networking/2019/

commit_message:
sync: add service_setup.yml

Since we're using service_setup.yml in most part of the services,
it's time we started synchronizing this file across repos to
reduce it's maintenance costs.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/676996
Change-Id: I5796025f542e855e9adadf58ba67157aeec6e213

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-08 02:40:17.000000000', 'message': 'qemu-img run slowly without proper permission

qemu-img run slowly without proper permission.
Without CAP_SYS_RAWIO, qemu-img will run slowly in nvme
when converting image(instance snapshot, nova file backend,
glance rbd backend)
Add CAP_SYS_RAWIO permission will improve the performance.

Change-Id: I67e9f0e8598c868fbaebac61a3223a90dfd519fe
Closes-Bug: #1839401
'}]
commit_message:
qemu-img run slowly without proper permission

qemu-img run slowly without proper permission.
Without CAP_SYS_RAWIO, qemu-img will run slowly in nvme
when converting image(instance snapshot, nova file backend,
glance rbd backend)
Add CAP_SYS_RAWIO permission will improve the performance.

Change-Id: I67e9f0e8598c868fbaebac61a3223a90dfd519fe
Closes-Bug: #1839401

commit_message:
Update series metadata

Ensure that EOL releases are removed from metadata
and tests, and that the current dev release is enabled
in metadata.  Dev release tests are enabled separately
because of chickens and eggs.

Change-Id: Id9f6ff405ba49ce8a786f8b2f1b82bc54aaa3a93

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-06-04 19:55:07.000000000', 'message': "POC: tests: autospecs all the mock.patch usages

By default, mock.patch's autospec argument is None, meaning that
there's no signature checking for the patched methods and funtions.

Wraps mock.patch methods to pass in a default autospec=True argument,
if not already given.
Adds unit test to verify that the newly wrapped mock.patch methods work
as intended.

NOTE: the current released version of mock does not support all of these,
thus, an unreleased version of mock is used for this POC.

Change-Id: I4484e63c97bd1cdde3d88855eabe7545784f365e

"}, {'created': '2018-01-28 22:26:00.000000000', 'message': "tests: autospecs all the mock.patch usages

By default, mock.patch's autospec argument is None, meaning that
there's no signature checking for the patched methods and funtions.

oslotest.mock_fixture.patch_mock_module fixes a few issues within
mock.patch functions, as well as setting autospec=True by default,
unless otherwise specified or new_callable, create, spec arguments
are passed in.

There are a few cases in which a method / function cannot be autospeced
properly (builtin functions like open, print). In these cases, we're
passing in autospec=False.

One specific example in which mock autospec doesn't work properly is for
sqlalchemy table methods. For example, the insert function [1] has a
required argument which is injected by the method's decorator. Autospecing
that method won't replicate the decorator's behaviour in any way, causing
the method signature validation to fail, as it expects at least an argument
to be passed in.

[1] https://github.com/zzzeek/sqlalchemy/blob/master/lib/sqlalchemy/sql/selectable.py#L1743

Partial-Bug: #1735588

Change-Id: I4484e63c97bd1cdde3d88855eabe7545784f365e

"}, {'created': '2018-07-05 13:02:49.000000000', 'message': "tests: autospecs all the mock.patch usages

By default, mock.patch's autospec argument is None, meaning that
there's no signature checking for the patched methods and functions.

oslotest.mock_fixture.patch_mock_module fixes a few issues within
mock.patch functions, as well as setting autospec=True by default,
unless otherwise specified or new_callable, create, spec arguments
are passed in.

There are a few cases in which a method / function cannot be autospeced
properly (builtin functions like open, print). In these cases, we're
passing in autospec=False.

One specific example in which mock autospec doesn't work properly is for
sqlalchemy table methods. For example, the insert function [1] has a
required argument which is injected by the method's decorator. Autospecing
that method won't replicate the decorator's behaviour in any way, causing
the method signature validation to fail, as it expects at least an argument
to be passed in.

[1] https://github.com/zzzeek/sqlalchemy/blob/master/lib/sqlalchemy/sql/selectable.py#L1743

Depends-On: Ib9709f1cf5dbed4792f5dd7c49d8f9c77f04419f

commit_message:
Tests: autospecs all the mock.patch usages

By default, mock.patch's autospec argument is None, meaning that
there's no signature checking for the patched methods and functions.

oslotest.mock_fixture.patch_mock_module fixes a few issues within
mock.patch functions, as well as setting autospec=True by default,
unless otherwise specified or new_callable, create, spec arguments
are passed in.

Co-Authored-By: Claudiu Belu <cbelu@cloudbasesolutions.com>
Change-Id: I4484e63c97bd1cdde3d88855eabe7545784f365e
Closes-Bug: #1735588

commit_message:
Convert filter_metadata_diff result to list

filter_metadata_diff method gives a way to whitelist/blacklist
differences between migration scripts and db models, for the
test_models_sync test.
The test fails on python3 because filter builtin on python3 returns
iterable instead of a list.
Fix this problem by returning always a list.

Change-Id: I7dfc3adf52131211dd3b9e180c82370d39779541

messages:

I too faced it when trying standalone edge based deployment where edge node had placement service enabled but not nova.'}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2019-08-19 06:32:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-08-19 18:00:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2019-08-19 21:45:40.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-19 04:16:40.000000000', 'message': "Don't mount /etc/nova into placement migrate script

The script mysql-migrate-db.sh [1] is driven entirely by environment
variables, and only does direct database operations, so there is no
need for a configured /etc/nova to exist within the container which
runs it.

This change removes the unused bind mount to
/var/lib/config-data/nova/etc/nova/. This directory doesn't exist when
nova isn't deployed, so this change allows placement to be deployed
without nova (which is a valid use-case).

Blueprint: nova-less-deploy

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/placement/src/branch/master/placement_db_tools/mysql-migrate-db.sh

Change-Id: I3d506944970a61354b7e8c034ea897d64660bfaa
"}]
commit_message:
Don't mount /etc/nova into placement migrate script

The script mysql-migrate-db.sh [1] is driven entirely by environment
variables, and only does direct database operations, so there is no
need for a configured /etc/nova to exist within the container which
runs it.

This change removes the unused bind mount to
/var/lib/config-data/nova/etc/nova/. This directory doesn't exist when
nova isn't deployed, so this change allows placement to be deployed
without nova (which is a valid use-case).

Blueprint: nova-less-deploy

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/placement/src/branch/master/placement_db_tools/mysql-migrate-db.sh

Change-Id: I3d506944970a61354b7e8c034ea897d64660bfaa

commit_message:
Add local development with FreeIPA focused featureset043

In order to deploy FreeIPA on the supplemental node using libvirt
for testing, you have historically needed to carry custom patches
to feature set 39 or manually hand in overrides at the cli while
invoking quickstart.sh.

Feature set 43 is derives from feature set 39. It has slight
variations to networking which allow for deploying supplemental node
(and other security features) using the libvirt/setup/supplemental
role.

Change-Id: Ib3fc1ef0b9065542a8995d70536252dc0b3af0ca

commit_message:
Update supplemental role to paramaterize networking

Maintaining a simple parameter rather than a hardcoded IP
is desired behavior.

Change-Id: I41d1358665043b0da61b3bba6694013a33af16f6

commit_message:
Update series metadata

Ensure that EOL releases are removed from metadata
and tests, and that the current dev release is enabled
in metadata.  Dev release tests are enabled separately
because of chickens and eggs.

Change-Id: Ie196f329f2f5b98960c895e2bfcf0ea8082ee2b4

commit_message:
Allow deep-linking to memory reservation section of AMD SEV spec

Add an anchor for the section of the AMD SEV spec which covers various
approaches to memory reservation, so that the incoming feature
documentation can deep-link to it.

Change-Id: I63e62d6d11ed1de51548ac196dc495b464e652d3

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-22 11:38:27.000000000', 'message': "Fix : sort variables fetched from env list

In bionic, when exporting env variables, the env list displays
variables in unsorted format.
While fetching we are getting 'https_proxy' before 'http_proxy'
which is failing in comparison to our expected values[1].
This patch sorts the variables fetched from env.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/30/643130/3/check/devstack-unit-tests/effbf7a/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-03-13_23_12_35_465026

Change-Id: Ie504eabf0d3fec1b97bc711e2702c06bcf75d158
(cherry picked from commit deadc7c439f1126ba986b9c4f3c4d0b6d7774016)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix : sort variables fetched from env list

In bionic, when exporting env variables, the env list displays
variables in unsorted format.
While fetching we are getting 'https_proxy' before 'http_proxy'
which is failing in comparison to our expected values[1].
This patch sorts the variables fetched from env.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/30/643130/3/check/devstack-unit-tests/effbf7a/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-03-13_23_12_35_465026

Change-Id: Ie504eabf0d3fec1b97bc711e2702c06bcf75d158
(cherry picked from commit deadc7c439f1126ba986b9c4f3c4d0b6d7774016)

subject: add psycopg2-binary
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-15 15:50:56.000000000', 'message': 'add psycopg2-binary

This patch adds psycopg2-binary which is a binary version of
psycopg2 which will install much quicker for testing purposes
and make it easier for users to test locally without needing
compilers and headers to run tests.

Change-Id: Ic765931f7362a1be970c4a2b6ff3b7051384b321
'}]
commit_message:
add psycopg2-binary

This patch adds psycopg2-binary which is a binary version of
psycopg2 which will install much quicker for testing purposes
and make it easier for users to test locally without needing
compilers and headers to run tests.

Change-Id: Ic765931f7362a1be970c4a2b6ff3b7051384b321

Yeah this makes sense since openstack-tox-py37 is voting and gating on nova changes:

So if we merge a bad requirement for py37 we'll break the gate for at least nova and that will set back the gate for other things most likely as well."}]

commit_message:
Add cross-nova-py37 job

A recent commit [1] started causing failures on py37 (see the related
bug). This could have been avoided by having at least one py37
check/gate job running on requirements changes, so this commit adds one.

Related-Bug: #1840551

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/675816/

Change-Id: I4be10c36e7ef64028cb5646a9e455a2eb1710b1e

commit_message:
Fix 'has_calls' method calls in unit tests

The 'has_calls' method does not exist in assertion methods of mock.
Replace the 'has_calls' method with an 'assert_has_calls' method or
an 'assert_called_once_with' method.
Add an 'assertEqual' check before an 'assert_has_calls' method.

Change-Id: I4b606fce473d064b9bb00213696c075cea020aaf
Closes-Bug: #1840200

messages: [{'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2019-08-16 17:42:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2019-08-16 18:44:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2019-08-19 06:11:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28008, 'date': '2019-08-19 19:12:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-16 17:42:02.000000000', 'message': 'Do not use a role scoped variable for role include condition

The var tempest_plugin_install_source is defined within the
os_tempest role so if it is used in the condition that includes
the python_venv_build role, it must be in scope for the python venv
build handler which runs in the outer containing playbook, and
this fails with a var not found error.

Change-Id: I7d1fd3b7d06d3a0c6d86750ed36cbe858190f87e
'}, {'created': '2019-08-16 18:44:30.000000000', 'message': 'Do not use a role scoped variable for role include condition

The var tempest_plugin_install_source is defined within the
os_tempest role so if it is used in the condition that includes
the python_venv_build role, it must be in scope for the python venv
build handler which runs in the outer containing playbook, and
this fails with a var not found error.

Change-Id: I7d1fd3b7d06d3a0c6d86750ed36cbe858190f87e
'}]
commit_message:
Do not use a role scoped variable for role include condition

The var tempest_plugin_install_source is defined within the
os_tempest role so if it is used in the condition that includes
the python_venv_build role, it must be in scope for the python venv
build handler which runs in the outer containing playbook, and
this fails with a var not found error.

Change-Id: I7d1fd3b7d06d3a0c6d86750ed36cbe858190f87e

commit_message:
Add ceph/ceph-ansible to untrusted github projects

Kolla-ansible plans to integrate with ceph-ansible
(kolla ceph deployment has been deprecated in Train [0])

Adding this will allow using ceph-ansible project in
required-projects for ceph-ansible related CI jobs.

[0]: https://docs.openstack.org/kolla-ansible/latest/reference/storage/ceph-guide.html

Change-Id: I725566c1b6eb6bf9ea663ce3e20d7e7237b7cea8

'}, {'created': '2019-07-29 13:51:24.000000000', 'message': 'Freeze LOCI images with a date

In the last patch to freeze images with a date, the LOCI images
were not added, do to the length of the patch [1].

This patch fixes the absence of LOCI based frozen image by
changing the CI appropriately, in the same way as the previous
patch ([1]).

However, LOCI configuration here was most of the time relying
on inheritance, which made bugs hard to find. This cleans up
the LOCI building by:
1) Having a common abstract profile for which all the main
   zuul variables are inherited
2) Making sure each branch has content without inheritance,
   but with only limited repetitions. This uses anchors
   to reduce the information to type about _projects, as
   the project details are most likely the same as master.

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/663744

'}, {'created': '2019-08-14 10:54:30.000000000', 'message': "Freeze LOCI images with a date

In the last patch to freeze images with a date, the LOCI images
were not added, do to the length of the patch [1].

This patch fixes the absence of LOCI based frozen image by
changing the CI appropriately, in the same way as the previous
patch ([1]).

However, LOCI configuration here was most of the time relying
on inheritance, which made bugs hard to find. This cleans up
the LOCI building by:
1) Having a common abstract profile for which all the main
   zuul variables are inherited
2) Making sure each branch has content without inheritance,
   but with only limited repetitions. This uses anchors
   to reduce the information to type about _projects, as
   the project details are most likely the same as master.

In addition to this, LOCI builds started to fail in Rocky branch,
for which a fix was implemented here (proving the ease of doing
so in the separation of branches!).

LOCI has removed the auto build of enum-compat, which is fine
for stein and above, as eventlet doesn't require it anymore.
However, for older versions, enum-compat is still required.
It's provided in the upper-constraints for all the branches
we are building, except Rocky. This adds a workaround for
Rocky.

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/663744

Change-Id: I6f33d5b7a33904cdd1c5ec352046ca9a9bca2aba

commit_message:
Freeze LOCI images with a date

In the last patch to freeze images with a date, the LOCI images
were not added, do to the length of the patch [1].

This patch fixes the absence of LOCI based frozen image by
changing the CI appropriately, in the same way as the previous
patch ([1]).

However, LOCI configuration here was most of the time relying
on inheritance, which made bugs hard to find. This cleans up
the LOCI building by:
1) Having a common abstract profile for which all the main
   zuul variables are inherited
2) Making sure each branch has content without inheritance,
   but with only limited repetitions. This uses anchors
   to reduce the information to type about _projects, as
   the project details are most likely the same as master.

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/663744

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/676398
Change-Id: I6f33d5b7a33904cdd1c5ec352046ca9a9bca2aba

'}, {'created': '2019-05-31 13:52:09.000000000', 'message': "Add support for Nautilus release

Resync charms.ceph to pickup changes to support new approach to
admin and bootstrap key generation with in the ceph-mon cluster.

Update get_mon_hosts to avoid specifying the port number for the
MON daemons; we use the default so this is not required, and at
Nautilus the MON daemons run both v1 and v2 messenger ports.

Specifying the port in the ceph.conf file disables the v2
messenger port which is not the desired behaviour on upgrade
or new installation.

Drop start hook; this has been present in the charm since its
inception as 'ceph' but is really not needed - re-deploying the
charm to units which previous hosted ceph-mon is dangerous
and the ceph-* daemons should still be running anyway.

commit_message:
Add support for Nautilus release

Resync charms.ceph to pickup changes to support new approach to
admin and bootstrap key generation with in the ceph-mon cluster.

Update get_mon_hosts to avoid specifying the port number for the
MON daemons; we use the default so this is not required, and at
Nautilus the MON daemons run both v1 and v2 messenger ports.

Specifying the port in the ceph.conf file disables the v2
messenger port which is not the desired behaviour on upgrade
or new installation.

Drop start hook; this has been present in the charm since its
inception as 'ceph' but is really not needed - re-deploying the
charm to units which previous hosted ceph-mon is dangerous
and the ceph-* daemons should still be running anyway.

Depends-On: I2dfab7404b72e314625ea554ee64595c5e26f3c6
Change-Id: I340dbf427551e6f9f8cd4ca89128627e497d6097

commit_message:
Add 'node' attribute to baremetal Allocation

This attribute is only used for create_allocation. When it is
specified, an allocation is created for an existing active node
without going through the normal allocation steps.

Change-Id: Ia0e54d7a38bdc50b163113c6435d49b33ced947d

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-01 06:30:39.000000000', 'message': 'Add exception message when user 'Create  Application Credential' with past date

When User tries to 'Create  Application Credential' with a past/old date,
User get an error message "Unable to create application credential" on horizon
but IMO we need to raise an error message like keystone "The 'expires_at'
date must not be before now". This patch corrects the error message.

Change-Id: I16e1a6c1bee39aa16b4f1507291f782b0bb80be7
Closes-Bug: #1838606
'}, {'created': '2019-08-07 09:39:29.000000000', 'message': 'Add exception message when user 'Create  Application Credential'

When User tries to 'Create  Application Credential' with a
past/old date, User get an error message
"Unable to create application credential" on horizon
but IMO we need to raise an error message like keystone
"The 'expires_at' date must not be before now". This patch corrects
the error message.

Change-Id: I16e1a6c1bee39aa16b4f1507291f782b0bb80be7
Closes-Bug: #1838606
'}]
commit_message:
Add exception message when user 'Create  Application Credential'

When User tries to 'Create  Application Credential' with a
past/old date, User get an error message
"Unable to create application credential" on horizon
but IMO we need to raise an error message like keystone
"The 'expires_at' date must not be before now". This patch corrects
the error message.

Change-Id: I16e1a6c1bee39aa16b4f1507291f782b0bb80be7
Closes-Bug: #1838606

commit_message:
Add option "--split" to command "ironic node-list"

Makes output of the above command readable, by splitting all the
nodes' data into separate smaller tables (one table per node).

Change-Id: I32cd07382d5618e12580e15e4a3af5f726f71ebf
Closes-Bug: #1528497

commit_message:
Fix 'X-Subject-Token' format which should without dashed

[1] is wrong amendment which had change the X-Subject-Token format.
Since [2] had been merged, this patch fix the format without dashed.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/399453/1/ironicclient/tests/unit/test_shell.py
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/398788

@vdrok. It occurs to me that we've deprecated the ironic CLI. I don't think we discussed what to do wrt future work/tests on it. I am fine with adding, more tests is always better, as long as it doesn't take a lot of effort to add them. Otherwise, maybe we should just focus on functional tests for osc commands only?"}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2017-11-01 19:34:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 27:

@vdrok, having said that, should we just land this and assume no more work is going to be done on it? Maybe we need to discuss with others...

btw, thanks Sergii & Kyrylo. Sorry that this patch has been around for so long, we need to get better/faster at reviewing. I'm waiting to become a superhero so I can do this faster :D"}, {'account_id': 12356, 'date': '2017-11-02 15:29:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 27:

> @vdrok, having said that, should we just land this and assume no
 > more work is going to be done on it? Maybe we need to discuss with
 > others...
 > 
 > btw, thanks Sergii & Kyrylo. Sorry that this patch has been around
 > for so long, we need to get better/faster at reviewing. I'm waiting
 > to become a superhero so I can do this faster :D

Hey Ruby, thanks for reviewing.

Neither Sergii nor Kyrylo are working on ironic (or in fact in mirantis) anymore. I was going through the bugs yesterday, and seen this patch, which seemed to me mergeable. I'm not sure if anyone is going to be updating it in the forseeable future, so I thought we need to either merge it, or unassign folks from the bug and set it to triaged. I'm fine with either option I think."}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2019-08-19 18:26:55.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Thanks for the patch. This won't be needed because we're deleting the 'ironic' command: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/676515/"}]

commit_message:
Tests for testing node-create command

Tests for the Ironic CLI commands which check actions with node-create
command.

Closes-Bug: #1529683
Co-Authored-By: Kyrylo Romanenko <kromanenko@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I8f4f96e57804b36ccc757bc71476d066288a9a42

commit_message:
Negative tests for testing actions with port.

Negative tests for the Ironic CLI commands. This tests checks port-create,
port-show, and port-delete: using them either without arguments
or with incorrect arguments.

Closes-Bug: #1527521
Change-Id: I6a265f6c73da4a7b14e89ec869832abc26d81cb9

commit_message:
Update series metadata

Ensure that EOL releases are removed from metadata
and tests, and that the current dev release is enabled
in metadata.  Dev release tests are enabled separately
because of chickens and eggs.

Change-Id: I94bbf5ec9ade6030561539371b4ca6a285b64d50

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-19 14:51:39.000000000', 'message': 'Be more relaxed when running lint on a single name

When eg. running "tox -elint -- barbican", the rendering works fine
but then the spec is not checked because barbican.spec.j2 renders to
openstack-barbican.spec . Be more relaxed when trying to find the
rendered spec file.

Change-Id: I589c3f64bffcbadb9457fd96b29197e684516c86
'}]
commit_message:
Be more relaxed when running lint on a single name

When eg. running "tox -elint -- barbican", the rendering works fine
but then the spec is not checked because barbican.spec.j2 renders to
openstack-barbican.spec . Be more relaxed when trying to find the
rendered spec file.

Change-Id: I589c3f64bffcbadb9457fd96b29197e684516c86

commit_message:
Removes monasca_grafana persistent volume

The monasca_grafana docker volume currently persists across container
builds, causing changes to installed plugins during build to be ignored.
This change deletes the volume entirely and forces plugin changes to be
applied via rebuild.

Change-Id: I36e62235a085e5c1955fdb5ae31f603be8ba69bf

subject: Fix NovaResumeGuestsStateOnHostBoot when using podman
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 17216, 'name': 'Martin Schuppert', 'email': 'mschuppert@redhat.com', 'username': 'mcschupp'}, {'_account_id': 20172, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@acksyn.org', 'username': 'michele'}, {'_account_id': 20733, 'name': 'Rajesh Tailor', 'email': 'ratailor@redhat.com', 'username': 'rajesht'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 30133, 'name': 'Piotr Kopec', 'email': 'pkopec17@gmail.com', 'username': 'pkopec'}]
messages: [{'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2019-08-19 08:23:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2019-08-19 08:23:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1\n\nwait for master'}, {'account_id': 30133, 'date': '2019-08-19 08:48:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2019-08-19 14:36:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2019-08-19 14:38:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-19 08:23:23.000000000', 'message': "Fix NovaResumeGuestsStateOnHostBoot when using podman

There is an issue if NovaResumeGuestsStateOnHostBoot gets enabled on the
initial deploy run. It tries to start libvirt-guests in the
host_prep_tasks task. While this is not an issue with docker where we run
the libvirt-guests direct on the host (outside a container), with podman
we run the libvirt-guests inside the container and in the initial deploy
we don't have the container at this stage.

This disables to start the tripleo_nova_libvirt_guests service in the
host_prep_tasks task in case of podman is used.

Change-Id: I7569ea69399807ce2efcc6ca9403db166181a2db
Closes-Bug: #1840618
(cherry picked from commit 13c6dc16a98f7b87921bd21838c6d91bc4159d3d)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix NovaResumeGuestsStateOnHostBoot when using podman

There is an issue if NovaResumeGuestsStateOnHostBoot gets enabled on the
initial deploy run. It tries to start libvirt-guests in the
host_prep_tasks task. While this is not an issue with docker where we run
the libvirt-guests direct on the host (outside a container), with podman
we run the libvirt-guests inside the container and in the initial deploy
we don't have the container at this stage.

This disables to start the tripleo_nova_libvirt_guests service in the
host_prep_tasks task in case of podman is used.

Change-Id: I7569ea69399807ce2efcc6ca9403db166181a2db
Closes-Bug: #1840618
(cherry picked from commit 13c6dc16a98f7b87921bd21838c6d91bc4159d3d)

commit_message:
Linting hardening with pre-commit

- Adds bashate test using v0.6.0
- Bump pre-commit-hooks release to v2.2.4
- Bump ansible-lint release to v4.1.0a0
- Fix some minor flake8 errors

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit cac3e7101d89c743ce2593141b9da4735be2fd33)

commit_message:
Numvfs setting during update/upgrade

Earlier numvfs is set by puppet-tripleo. Now during update/upgrade,
the numvfs setting and persistence across reboot shall be managed
by os-net-config with the corresponding setting of numvfs via
nic-configs. However the numvfs value can't be changed during
the update/upgrade.

Change-Id: I717d822eb64f95c129bcfd66b553784643333f0e
(cherry picked from commit d9ea668972d192db3e78a493890522d0d10902a1)

commit_message:
Numvfs setting during update/upgrade

Earlier numvfs is set by puppet-tripleo. Now during update/upgrade,
the numvfs setting and persistence across reboot shall be managed
by os-net-config with the corresponding setting of numvfs via
nic-configs. However the numvfs value can't be changed during
the update/upgrade.

Change-Id: I717d822eb64f95c129bcfd66b553784643333f0e
(cherry picked from commit d9ea668972d192db3e78a493890522d0d10902a1)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-15 06:29:25.000000000', 'message': 'Support TLS priorities for pacemaker

Introduce a PacemakerTLSPriorities parameter (which will set the
PCMK_tls_priorities config option in /etc/sysconfig/pacemaker and the
PCMK_tls_priorities variable inside the bundle. This, when set, allows
an operator to specify what kind of GNUTLS ciphers are desired for the
pacemaker control port.

Tested on both queens and stein. Via a deploy and a redeploy against
existing cloud. Observed that:
A) We got PCMK_tls_priorities inside /etc/sysconfig/pacemaker with the
value that was passed in THT
B) Containers had the following env variable set:
  "PCMK_tls_priorities=normal",

NB: cherry-pick not 100% clean

(cherry-picked from commit feee059a439e16f4bc179ea007567d05ef63220f)
Depends-On: I703b5a429f48063474aace85bc45d948f5c91435
Change-Id: I2a2ea8bfa4da35fa8721b14909b0968123379558

commit_message:
Support TLS priorities for pacemaker

Introduce a PacemakerTLSPriorities parameter (which will set the
PCMK_tls_priorities config option in /etc/sysconfig/pacemaker and the
PCMK_tls_priorities variable inside the bundle. This, when set, allows
an operator to specify what kind of GNUTLS ciphers are desired for the
pacemaker control port.

Tested on both queens and stein. Via a deploy and a redeploy against
existing cloud. Observed that:
A) We got PCMK_tls_priorities inside /etc/sysconfig/pacemaker with the
value that was passed in THT
B) Containers had the following env variable set:
  "PCMK_tls_priorities=normal",

NB: cherry-pick not 100% clean

(cherry-picked from commit feee059a439e16f4bc179ea007567d05ef63220f)
Depends-On: I703b5a429f48063474aace85bc45d948f5c91435
Change-Id: I2a2ea8bfa4da35fa8721b14909b0968123379558

commit_message:
Use mysql LONGTEXT for atomdetails results

With a lot of possible retries using mysql sa.Text for result field
atomdetails table is not enough.

Updated 'results' column type to LONGTEXT in mysql backend case.

PosgreSQL seems not to be affected as postgres text type is not
having length limitation.

Co-Authored-By: Michael Johnson <johnsomor@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I4e44e3288ae49d85c5b5ce8ff26ba83f3b9d2c7b
Closes-bug: #1838015

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-19 16:57:53.000000000', 'message': 'Include ref info on stmp reporter subjects

Our old log urls had ref info in them which people were relying on to
determine what refs jobs reported via smtp ran against. With changes to
the zuul dashboard being the log location the links now only have a
build uuid and lack ref info.

Update the pipeline smtp reporter subject to include the change.ref
object which should give this info to users again.

Change-Id: If81710baa528be779762730e9593b32841ffcb56
'}]
commit_message:
Include ref info on stmp reporter subjects

Our old log urls had ref info in them which people were relying on to
determine what refs jobs reported via smtp ran against. With changes to
the zuul dashboard being the log location the links now only have a
build uuid and lack ref info.

Update the pipeline smtp reporter subject to include the change.ref
object which should give this info to users again.

Change-Id: If81710baa528be779762730e9593b32841ffcb56

pymod2pkg: Release 0.19.0

This release adds a translation rule for SUSE & RDO for
networking-l2gw. It also adds a new rule for aodh and
barbican for SUSE.

commit_message:
Mark networking-generic-switch-tempest release deprecated

The networking-generic-switch-tempest plugin repository was
never used and the code was actually included in-tree with
networking-generic-switch.

Per https://review.opendev.org/#/c/674285/1, I'm submitting
the release-management key to be marked as deprecated for
this repostiory.

Change-Id: Icf6729ee00f208a37c91337e0759f1532c9de7b9

commit_message:
Unbreak CI: fluentd and TripleO dependency

fluentd - we are not deploying kubernetes, no need for plugins
TripleO - CI currently broken (to reverse, FIXME in place)
- dropped TripleO from gate

Change-Id: I203f70176af7f2b53398ddeb5c21e6234a45e268
Signed-off-by: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 07b55048e63f27c1045735624c845d1af95a11fd)

commit_message:
Fixes wrong local_setting.py file issue for Ubuntu binary deployment.

This bug both affects Rocky and Stein. local_setting.py was not
linked to local_settings under /etc/openstack-dashboard so Horizon
runs with default settings.

Change-Id: I818876619694695663c98d9edcb8c8514198e8fd
Closes-Bug: #1803029

commit_message:
Adds log_filters parameter to nova::compute::libvirt

Defines a filter to select a different logging level
for a given category log outputs, as specified in
https://libvirt.org/logging.html. Default undef

Change-Id: Ic48afe856ae60654d6cebf627b12509881933c59
Related-Bug: #1840140

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-08 22:02:01.000000000', 'message': 'Change heat-dashboard release model

Since heat-dashboard was only released once last cycle AND it has not
yet been released this cycle yet either, we propose to change it to the
cycle-with-rc model which is better for deliverables that do a single
release per cycle.

There are three options for responding:

1) If you know you will only do one release this cycle, +1.
2) If you know you will do more than one, please release now and -1
this change.
3) If you have no idea when you will release, please please please
propose one BEFORE rc1 and -1 this change.

Change-Id: Id970cbce3f716e221690d9c9522b6752b52118c1
'}]
commit_message:
Change heat-dashboard release model

Since heat-dashboard was only released once last cycle AND it has not
yet been released this cycle yet either, we propose to change it to the
cycle-with-rc model which is better for deliverables that do a single
release per cycle.

There are three options for responding:

1) If you know you will only do one release this cycle, +1.
2) If you know you will do more than one, please release now and -1
this change.
3) If you have no idea when you will release, please please please
propose one BEFORE rc1 and -1 this change.

Change-Id: Id970cbce3f716e221690d9c9522b6752b52118c1

I guess we could discuss whether this makes sense for branchless deliverables, but at least right now we have a rule that the first release in a new series needs to at least increment the Y in the X.Y.Z version. 

"deliverables/train/sahara-tests.yaml: validate_series_first: Initial releases in a series must increment at least the minor version or be beta versions. '0.9.1'"

This was typically to make sure there was room for stable bugfix releases, but I could see how that might not be of any concern for something that can't ever do a stable release.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-08-09 12:55:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-08-09 15:24:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2019-08-12 15:53:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

commit_message:
Enable database user management and password rotation

  * Add a script to create, update and grant specific permission to DB
  * Add a job template to execute the script and provision the user
  * Add a user access testing to the script

subject: Change networking-baremetal release model
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2019-08-08 22:13:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-08-09 16:29:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Thanks for starting the discussion! I'd rather not do this though.

It's true that we don't release networking-baremetal often, but it's because the changes here happen in spikes. More importantly, there can be tight dependencies between ironic and networking-baremetal, which may require to release networking-baremetal ASAP at some point."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-08-19 15:21:59.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-08 22:13:25.000000000', 'message': 'Change networking-baremetal release model

Since networking-baremetal was only released once last cycle AND it has not
yet been released this cycle yet either, we propose to change it to the
cycle-with-rc model which is better for deliverables that do a single
release per cycle.

There are three options for responding:

1) If you know you will only do one release this cycle, +1.
2) If you know you will do more than one, please release now and -1
this change.
3) If you have no idea when you will release, please please please
propose one BEFORE rc1 and -1 this change.

Change-Id: Id6d8c2178330bf3c96a771aefa5a0f5323ad9d71
'}]
commit_message:
Change networking-baremetal release model

Since networking-baremetal was only released once last cycle AND it has not
yet been released this cycle yet either, we propose to change it to the
cycle-with-rc model which is better for deliverables that do a single
release per cycle.

There are three options for responding:

1) If you know you will only do one release this cycle, +1.
2) If you know you will do more than one, please release now and -1
this change.
3) If you have no idea when you will release, please please please
propose one BEFORE rc1 and -1 this change.

Change-Id: Id6d8c2178330bf3c96a771aefa5a0f5323ad9d71

commit_message:
Tighten unit test dict assertions

Assert that a key is not present rather than
that .get(key) returns None.

Closes-Bug: #1613154

Change-Id: Ic165676b2574a0dcf0ad8714c8328dd82c2681f7
